Package generation

Class MazeBuilderBoruvka

java.lang.Object
generation.MazeBuilder
generation.MazeBuilderBoruvka
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class MazeBuilderBoruvka extends generation.MazeBuilder implements Runnable
This class has the responsibility to create a maze of given dimensions (width, height) together with a solution based on a distance matrix. The MazeBuilder implements Runnable such that it can be run a separate thread. The MazeFactory has a MazeBuilder and handles the thread management. The maze is built with a randomized version of Boruvka's algorithm. This means a spanning tree is expanded into a set of cells by removing wallboards from the maze. Algorithm sets up every inner wall, tears down these walls according to boruvka until perfect maze Boruvka aspect: each cell is treated like an unconnected node, all the cells start with wallboards between them the same way that unconnected nodes would then I begin the process of connecting nodes based on the which edge connecting the node to another node is the cheapest by tearing down the cheapest wallboard, that is a proxy for creating the cheapest edge for a node.
Author:
Jones.Andrew, refactored by Peter Kemper

    adjustor method to be used after the first initial set of wall teardowns cycles through and find all cells part of tree group 1 ( will cycle through different groups) find all of them that have border with other tree (by tree id diff) select cheapest edge from that border listing deletes the border it an merge everything (take a for loop to run through every cell)

    • getEdgeWeight

      public int getEdgeWeight(int x, int y, generation.CardinalDirection cd)
      adjusting method will be used to generate a deterministic edge weight check if this edge has been visited if it has been visited then retrieve previous weight if it has not been visited then assign a new edge weight and store that in an array somewhere
      Parameters:
      int - for the x value of cell, int for y value of cell, cardinal direction of the wall for that cell
      Returns:
      int that represents edge weight for that wall

    • tieBreaker

      public int tieBreaker()
      helper function will return 1 or 0 to represent an assigned direction utilize random number generator deals with identical wall edge weight values
      Returns:
      an int either 1 or 2 that will be used to break ties will tearing down walls randomly

    • isPreferred

      public generation.CardinalDirection isPreferred(int x, int y, int toCompare)
      helper function will return the direction that has the lightest weight returns null if the cheapest weight was already found and the remaining weights are all heavier than the previous cheaper weight with each comparison of the minimum makes sure that the wall can actually be torn down
      Parameters:
      x - is the x value of cell, y is y value of cell, toCompare is the current minimum value of all the edge weights burrowed through this run
      Returns:
      null if cheapest edge weight has already been found or a cardinal direction for the wallboard with the cheapest edge weight for that cell for this burrow run

    • treeJoiner

      public void treeJoiner(int treeGroup)
      adjustor method to be used after the first initial set of wall teardowns cycles through and find all cells part of tree group 1 ( will cycle through different groups) find all of them that have border with other tree (by tree id diff) select cheapest edge from that border listing deletes the border it an merge everything (take a for loop to run through every cell)
      Parameters:
      treeGroup - is an integer representing the tree group that I want to merge with its cheapest neighboring tree
